channel.title: About science
channel.description:
Interview series on variety of science-related subjects, produced by the California Institute of Technology. Features three Cal Tech faculty members: Dr. Peter Lissaman, Dr. Albert R. Hibbs, and Dr. Robert Meghreblian.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: About dissecting a star
item.description: This program focuses on the science of stars. The guest for this program is Dr. Robert Christy.
item.dc:creator: Hibbs, Albert R.
item.dc:subject: Stars

item.title: About superhot atmospheres
item.description: This program focuses on the scientific study of superhot atmospheres. The guest for this program is Dr. Arthur Vaughan, Jr.
item.dc:creator: Hibbs, Albert R.
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About communication between scientists and laymen
item.description: This program focuses on the gap of understanding between scientists and non-scientists. The guest for this program is science writer Irving Bengelsdorf.
item.dc:creator: Hibbs, Albert R.
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About life on Mars?
item.description: This program explores the quest to find life on Mars. The guest for this program is Dr. Norman Horowitz, California Institute of Technology.
item.dc:creator: Meghreblian, Robert V. (Robert Vartan)
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About meteorites
item.description: This program focuses on the scientific study of meteorites. The guest for this program is Irene Goddard.
item.dc:creator: Hibbs, Albert R.
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About thin shells
item.description: This program focuses on thin shells, structures that are very thin in one direction, as compared to another direction.
item.dc:creator: Meghreblian, Robert V. (Robert Vartan)
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About exobiology
item.description: This program discusses exobiology, the search for life beyond Earth, and the effects of extraterrestrial environments on living things. The guest for this program is Jerry Soffen.
item.dc:creator: Meghreblian, Robert V. (Robert Vartan)
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About science in Japan
item.description: This program focuses on the state of science in Japan.
item.dc:creator: Lissaman, Peter B. S.
item.dc:subject: Science--Japan--History--20th century

item.title: About the Moon
item.description: This program focuses on scientific study of the Moon. The guest for this program is Dr. Albert Hibbs, California Institute of Technology.
item.dc:creator: Lissaman, Peter B. S.
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About engineering aspects of the cardiovascular system
item.description: This program focuses on the study of the engineering aspects of the cardiovascular system. The guest for this program is Dr. Michael G. Taylor.
item.dc:creator: Lissaman, Peter B. S.
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About the oldest mountain range
item.description: This program focuses on scientific study of the oldest mountain range. The guest for this program is Dr. Leon Silver.

item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About current developments in family planning
item.description: This program focuses on family planning. The guest for this program is Dr. Robert W. Gillespie.

item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About the new chemistry
item.description: This program focuses on the state of chemistry. The guest for the program is Dr. George Hammond.

item.title: About seaweed
item.description: This program connections between seaweed and science. The guest for this program is Dr. Wheeler North, California Institute of Technology.
item.dc:creator: California Institute of Technology
item.dc:subject: Seaweed

item.title: About elastic water
item.description: This program discusses the accidental discovery of "elastic water," a mixture of plastic and water. The guest for this program is the man who made the discovery, David James.
item.dc:creator: Hibbs, Albert R.
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About earthquake engineering
item.description: This program focuses on the science of earthquake engineering. The guest for this program is Paul Jennings.

item.title: About color vision
item.description: This program focuses on vision and the color spectrum. The guest for this program is Dr. Richard P. Feynman, 1965 Nobel Laureate, winner of the Albert Einstein Award, professor of theoretical physics at California Institute of Technology.
item.dc:creator: Hibbs, Albert R.
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: About international cooperation in space
item.description: This program focuses on international cooperation in space exploration.

item.description: This program focuses on the social science field of political geography and the study of Africa. The guest for this program is Dr. Edwin Munger.
